headline: Potential Warnock vs. Walker Georgia Senate Battle Shows It Could Be A Close Race
author: Murjani Rawls
sentences: The former NFL running back is said to be in the lead with nearly two-thirds of Republican voters' support, while all his opponents were in the single digits, as an Atlanta Journal-Constitution survey conducted in April showed.

A recent round of polling shows that Sen. Raphael Warnock (D-GA) is looking at a close race, presuming GOP candidate Herschel Walker wins the Republican nomination for the upcoming Georgia Senate race, according to Newsweek.

Georgia has a been a traditionally red state, but the wins by Warnock, Sen. John Ossoff, and the potential for Stacey Abrams to beat Republican governor Brian Kemp could show Democrats have been making progress.
The GOP candidate had a slight advantage of just 1 point, with 49 percent support among registered voters as opposed to only 48 percent for the Democratic incumbent.
Depending on what poll you consult, they show that a potential Warnock vs. Walker matchup for the Georgia Senate seat will be a fight to the finish.
That survey, conducted by WXIA-TV/SurveyUSA from April 22 to 27, puts the Democrat at 50 percent, compared with his opponent's 45 percent.
When Sen. Warnock defeated former Senator Kelly Loeffler in the 2020 Georgia runoff, it was a close race, but the Atlanta pastor won.
The current Real Clear Politics average of Georgia polls has the Republican contender ahead of the Democrat by 0.5 percentage points.
Things like an Election Police Unit' and the Election Integrity Act' will not make things easy, but turnout will always be the key.
Loeffler had never won an electionmuch like the opponent Warnock would be facing if Herschel Walker won the Republican nomination.
Let's preface this to say most of these polls are only comprised of a pool of over 1,000 voters in each instance.
A late-January poll by Quinnipiac University showed a nearly tied contest between Warnock and Walker.
Meanwhile, the most recent poll shows Warnock with a 5-point lead over the Trump-backed candidate.
That survey had a margin of error of 2.4 percentage points and polled 1,702 respondents.
It polled 1,278 likely voters and had a margin of error of plus or minus 3.4 percent.
Walker has an average of 47.3 percent, compared with Warnock's 46.8 percent.
Georgia's primary takes place on May 24th.
